title: Watch: Decades of dead ends: The struggle for a Palestinian state | Realpolitik

In this episode of Realpolitik, Stanly Johny breaks down the historical, political, and strategic factors behind the absence of a Palestinian state and why the stakes are higher than ever.

title: Married woman, teen lover murder 6-year-old who saw them in 'compromising position'
description: In a shocking incident in Sikandra Rau, a six-year-old girl, Urvi, was murdered after she discovered a woman and a teenage boy in a compromising situation. Fearing Urvi would reveal their secret, the pair strangled her and disposed of her body in a well. The woman has been arrested, and the boy detained, with police investigations ongoing.

title: 'Let's go!': Sunil Chhetri on Virat Kohli's fitness: drops a massive hint
description: Sunil Chhetri, former India football captain, has revealed details about Virat Kohli's fitness. Kohli shared his fitness test scores with Chhetri. Chhetri compared Kohli's dedication to Cristiano Ronaldo. He highlighted their relentless pursuit of excellence. Chhetri emphasized the importance of focusing on the present. He also noted how Kohli and Ronaldo consistently strive for improvement. Their commitment is truly remarkable.

Hansda, a Zonal Commander, had a reward of Rs 10 lakh on his head. The joint operation by the COBRA battalion and district police also led to the recovery of weapons, including an SLR rifle.

The young woman's desire to marry someone of her choice was met with opposition from her parents, leading to the fatal confrontation.

description: Devastating floods in Punjab have significantly hampered efforts to expand the state's diminishing green cover, resulting in the loss of 4,94,956 trees across 776 hectares. With forest cover already low at 3.7% of its geographical area, the floods have deepened Punjab's ecological stress and caused an estimated damage of over Rs 360.5 lakh to the forest and wildlife preservation department.

9-year-old’s body found in pond in West Bengal, mob lynch neighbours on suspicion
description: A nine-year-old's death in Tehatta, Nadia district, triggered a violent mob lynching. Swarnabha Mondal, missing since Friday, was found dead in a pond. Locals, suspecting Utpal and Soma Biswas due to a family feud, attacked their home, resulting in their deaths. Police inaction is alleged, with locals claiming quicker response could have prevented the tragedies. An investigation is underway.

Manipur pact: NH-2 reopening sparks tension; Kuki groups warn against 'free passage'
description: The reopening of National Highway-2, a vital supply route, has stirred unease in Manipur's peace process. Kuki-Zo armed groups, KNO and UPF, cautioned against interpreting it as acceptance of unrestricted movement between communities. This follows a renewed ceasefire agreement with the Centre, focusing on territorial integrity and a political solution.

title: Weekly Horoscope 7 September, 2025- 13 September, 2025: Aries, Pisces and other sun signs – check astrological predictions

description: Former White House advisor Peter Navarro has accused India of profiteering from Russian oil purchases, alleging that India didn't buy any before the Ukraine invasion and is now fueling Russia's war efforts. These remarks have been strongly refuted by India's Ministry of External Affairs, which dismissed them as inaccurate and misleading.

description: Noida police swiftly responded to a distressing video posted on social media by a woman threatening suicide, alleging her husband and others had ruined her life. Using the IP address, officers located her in Sector 28 within 20 minutes, intervening to prevent her from harming herself.

title: How chess legend Boris Gelfand lost to Praggnanandhaa in one single blunder at FIDE Grand Swiss
Gurgaon: ‘Cremated’ man walks home a day later
description: Gurgaon police were left baffled after Poojan Prasad, presumed dead and cremated by his son, returned home a day later. Police had identified a mutilated body as Prasad based on a missing person report and family claims. The cremation took place before Prasad's brother-in-law spotted him alive.

description: The Kerala Congress unit faced backlash after an X post drew parallels between 'bidis and Bihar,' leading to accusations of defaming the people of Bihar. V T Balram stepped down as head of the party's digital media cell following the controversy.

title: AI godfather warns: Hinton on AI’s ‘nuclear’ threat; 'can help create bioweapons'
description: Geoffrey Hinton, a prominent AI figure, expresses serious concerns about AI's potential dangers, shifting from promoting its development to warning about its threats. He envisions AI empowering individuals to create bioweapons, akin to nuclear threats, and surpassing human emotional capabilities. While Hinton believes AI possesses genuine intelligence, his former colleague Yann LeCun holds a contrasting view on its limitations.

title: 'Slapped 50–60 times': Classmates assault UP law student inside private university
description: In Lucknow's Chinhat, a law student was allegedly assaulted and threatened by a group of fellow students inside his university campus. The victim, Shikhar, was attacked in a car, enduring physical abuse and intimidation. An FIR has been lodged, and police are investigating the incident, which has left the student traumatized and fearing for his safety.

title: Nepal social media ban: Facebook, Twitter among 26 apps blocked; Govt explains why
description: Nepal has banned major social media platforms like Facebook, YouTube, and X after they failed to register with the government by the given deadline. This decision follows a Supreme Court directive to regulate online platforms and monitor content.
